channel.title: What is client.java?
channel.description: hey everybody! I knoqw this is probally the lamest question on the forum, but really, I cant find client.java, nor do i know what it is. If you can help me attain this, I'd very much appreciate the help. And thanks for caring lol. :confused:

item.title: What is client.java?
item.dc:creator: @fualtycannon fualtycannon
item.description:
@fualtycannon wrote:

Awsome, thanks so much, and sorry for bieng a total noob lol. And when i donwload mopar/silab, the client file will be with it, and I should back it up? Now when I want to add to moparscape, like the add the G.E. for ex. I would add to the bottom of the java file, or make a new one, compile, and they work together as seperate files?

Read full topic

item.title: What is client.java?
item.dc:creator: @Retard_Monkey Retard Monkey
item.description:
@Retard_Monkey wrote:

Fualty, moparscape client probably won’t be in there, It definitely won’t be in your client.java though. If you can’t find it, search your computer for whatever you named it or just use mopar/silab webclient. Btw fualty you will need jdk to compile. Heres a link:
http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
Click on the second option to download, JDK 6 update 7.

Read full topic

item.title: What is client.java?
item.dc:creator: @Retard_Monkey Retard Monkey
item.description:
@Retard_Monkey wrote:

Well first of all you do have a source or some server files, yes?

Assuming you do, go into them. Now, do not open any of the many files you see, but instead press the ‘c’ letter on your keyboard until a notepad file names ‘Client’ is highlighted. Now, open that.

This is your client.java file.
Here you edit a hell of alot about your server.
Don’t do anything in there unless you know that it is either backed up or it is going to work, or both. There are lots of tutorials about changing stuff using client.java, but after you’re finished editing client.java, save it and compile your server to see the changes take effect.

If something goes wrong, just request help.

Read full topic
